video.name: BANANA BREAD BAKED OATMEAL 7 Ingr- No Oil | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Vegan Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal! 7 Ingredient Warm Spiced
Banana Oatmeal for breakfast or snack. Refined Oil-free!
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2019/09/banana-bread-baked-oatmeal-vegan.html
Indian Kitchen Cookbook: https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-richas-indian-kitchen-cookbook
Everyday Kitchen Cookbook: https://www.veganricha.com/vrek

This Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal is almost a healthy banana bread with all the good stuff. Serve it with whipped coconut cream or vegan butter and some maple. Use very ripe bananas for the best result. This lightly sweet Banana oatmeal is perfect to make on any day. It takes 10 mins to put together and just 7 ingredients, and has no added Oil! You can add in dried fruit, seeds and nuts of choice. You can also make it ahead, mix and keep overnight and bake in the morning for a Warm Banana bread-y spiced delicious oatmeal!

Music: Beach by MBB 

#veganricha #bananabakedoatmeal #easyveganrecipes #veganbreakfast 

Follow
My blog: https://veganricha.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/VeganRicha
Instagram: https://instagram.com/veganricha
Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/veganricha
Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/veganricha/

recipeIngredient: 4 tbsp maple syrup ((use 2 tbsp if using ripe bananas or serving with maple syrup)**)
1.75 cups old fashioned oats (, use certified gluten-free if needed, see notes for substitution)
1 tsp ground cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice or a mix of cinnamon and nutmeg
3 tbsp chopped pecans or walnuts (, or omit for nutfree)
optional add ins: 1-2 tbsp seeds of choice such chia or pumpkin seeds, (chopped dates, chocolate chips, dried fruit)
1 cup  non dairy milk such as coconut or almond
1 tsp coconut, (1 tsp coconut sugar,  a pinch of cinnamon and pecans for topping)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 deg F (180 C).
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 deg F (180 C).

recipeInstructions.text: Mash the banana in the baking dish, mash until there are no lumps. Mix in half the maple syrup until combined. Bake for 11 mins. This cooks the banana to make it sweeter and more caramelized banana bread flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: Mash the banana in the baking dish, mash until there are no lumps. Mix in half the maple syrup until combined. Bake for 11 mins. This cooks the banana to make it sweeter and more caramelized banana bread flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the dry ingredients(oats, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, nuts and coconut in a bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the dry ingredients(oats, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, nuts and coconut in a bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the baking dish from the oven. Add the oat mixture to the dish. Add non dairy milk and remaining maple syrup and mix well. Even it out. Sprinkle coconut, coconut sugar, cinnamon and pecans on the oatmeal. At this point you can refrigerate the dish overnight. Cover the top and refrigerate, then bake when needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the baking dish from the oven. Add the oat mixture to the dish. Add non dairy milk and remaining maple syrup and mix well. Even it out. Sprinkle coconut, coconut sugar, cinnamon and pecans on the oatmeal. At this point you can refrigerate the dish overnight. Cover the top and refrigerate, then bake when needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 30 to 35 mins or until golden on the edges and the center is not sticky and springs back when pressed.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 30 to 35 mins or until golden on the edges and the center is not sticky and springs back when pressed.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool for 10 mins, then slice and serve warm with maple syrup, vegan butter or whipped coconut cream or non dairy yogurt, fresh fruits or other toppings.Store: Store unbaked at step 4. Store baked oatmeal in a closed container in the fridge for upto 4 days. Reheat: Reheat the refrigerated oatmeal in a microwave or in the oven for 10 mins or so to crisp up.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool for 10 mins, then slice and serve warm with maple syrup, vegan butter or whipped coconut cream or non dairy yogurt, fresh fruits or other toppings.Store: Store unbaked at step 4. Store baked oatmeal in a closed container in the fridge for upto 4 days. Reheat: Reheat the refrigerated oatmeal in a microwave or in the oven for 10 mins or so to crisp up.
